question.title: Will WHO publish an update indicating at least one additional country or territory has been certified malaria-free, before May 1, 2026?
question.description:
WHO malaria-free certification is a high-signal milestone for elimination progress and often reflects years of sustained surveillance and control capacity.

`{"format":"bot_tournament_question","info":{"hash_id":"bf931cb58cd65530","sheet_id":190.1}}`
question.resolution_criteria: This question resolves Yes if, after the time the question opens and before May 1, 2026, the WHO Global Malaria Programme page “Countries and territories certified malaria-free by WHO” shows ) at least one country/territory listed with certification year “2026” that was not present on the version of the page at question open. The primary source is the WHO page (use the “Last update” line and the country list on that page): [https://www.who.int/teams/global-malaria-programme/elimination/countries-and-territories-certified-malaria-free-by-who](https://www.who.int/teams/global-malaria-programme/elimination/countries-and-territories-certified-malaria-free-by-who).
question.fine_print: If a new certification occurs but the page is not updated within the time condition, resolve No. If the page is unavailable at resolution time, use the backup candidate source below; if both are unavailable, follow the credible-sources policy: [https://www.metaculus.com/help/question-checklist/](https://www.metaculus.com/help/question-checklist/). Candidate Sources (backup, used only if needed): WHO newsroom search results for “certified malaria-free” (resolver should confirm publication date and WHO authorship): [https://www.who.int/search?query=certified%20malaria-free](https://www.who.int/search?query=certified%20malaria-free).
